what: Basic Routing for Shiny Web Applications
title: Basic Routing for Shiny Web Applications
text: minimalistic router Shiny apps. Now ’s possible recreate state app, providing specific URL, like:

title: Basic Routing for Shiny Web Applications
text: ’s possible install library CRAN recent version can get repo using remotes.

title: Basic Routing for Shiny Web Applications
text: Basic usage: Check tutorial details start using shiny.router read article Appsilon’s blog.
code: library(shiny) library(shiny.router)  root_page <- div(h2("Root page")) other_page <- div(h3("Other page"))  router <- make_router(   route("/", root_page),   route("other", other_page) )  ui <- fluidPage(   title = "Router demo",   router$ui )  server <- function(input, output, session) {   router$server(input, output, session) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

title: Basic Routing for Shiny Web Applications
text: application showcases shiny.router features can found :  built using two Appsilon Open Source packages: rhino - R package designed help building high quality, enterprise-grade Shiny applications speed. shiny.fluent - Microsoft’s Fluent UI Shiny apps. can also visit examples directory complete samples.

title: Creates router. — make_router

title: 404 page — page404
text: page shiny page style, eg. shiny::tags$div(h1("found")) message404 message display 404 website

title: 404 page — page404
code:
page404() # shiny::tags$div(h1("Not found")) #>
#>

Not found

#>
page404(message404 = "ABC") # shiny::tags$div(h1("ABC")) #>
#>

ABC

#>
